docs.lead_paragraph: The drug, which directly counteracts the genetic defect that causes cystic fibrosis, might help as many as half of American patients.

headline.main: Cystic Fibrosis Drug Wins Approval of F.D.A. Advisory Panel
headline.print_headline: Cystic Fibrosis Drug Wins Approval of an F.D.A. Panel

docs.abstract: Food and Drug Administration advisory committee recommends approval for Orkambi, drug developed by Vertex Pharmaceuticals that could help nearly half of all patients with cystic fibrosis.
docs.snippet: The drug, which directly counteracts the genetic defect that causes cystic fibrosis, might help as many as half of American patients.

docs.lead_paragraph: Jim Greenwood of the Biotechnology Industry Organization calls for an examination of “the insurance industry’s recent expansion of the use of specialty tier cost-sharing, in which patients must pay a relatively high percentage of their drug costs.”
docs.snippet: Jim Greenwood of the Biotechnology Industry Organization calls for an examination of “the insurance industry’s recent expansion of the use of specialty tier cost-sharing, in which patients must pay a relatively high percentage of their...

docs.lead_paragraph: The West African nation, which is improving its health care systems, now has Ebola under control after being overwhelmed by the disease last year.

headline.main: Liberia, Ravaged by Ebola, Faces a Future Without It
headline.print_headline: Seeing End of Ebola, Liberia Tries to Repair What Fueled It

docs.abstract: Liberia, which is expected to be declared free of Ebola virus by World Health Organization, is making sweeping changes to health care system whose failings led country to become center of deadliest Ebola epidemic in history; nation has now gone 42 days since last victim was buried.
docs.snippet: The West African nation, which is improving its health care systems, now has Ebola under control after being overwhelmed by the disease last year.

docs.lead_paragraph: Numerous bills have been passed by Republican-controlled legislatures this year that make it harder for women to terminate their pregnancies.

headline.main: State Legislatures Put Up Flurry of Roadblocks to Abortion
headline.print_headline: With Flurry of Bills, Republican Legislatures Make Abortions Harder to Get

docs.abstract: Raft of new laws passed by number of Republican-led State Legislatures are making it harder for women around United States to obtain legal abortions, with 37 new rules in 11 states chipping away at availability of procedure; many doctors dispute assertions that legislation improves women's health, while pro-choice advocates say restrictions will result in more illegal abortions.
docs.snippet: Numerous bills have been passed by Republican-controlled legislatures this year that make it harder for women to terminate their pregnancies.

docs.lead_paragraph: Federal health regulators say an experimental combination drug for cystic fibrosis developed by Vertex Pharmaceuticals Incorporated helped improve breathing in patients with the deadly inherited disease.

headline.main: FDA Questions Benefit of Cystic Fibrosis Drug From Vertex
headline.print_headline: FDA Questions Benefit of Cystic Fibrosis Drug From Vertex

docs.snippet: Federal health regulators say an experimental combination drug for cystic fibrosis developed by Vertex Pharmaceuticals Incorporated helped improve breathing in patients with the deadly inherited disease.
